name: Mushroom, Corn and Bacon Chowder
description: An amazingly creamy chowder, loaded with tons of veggies. It’s hearty, nutritious and so comforting! 245.9 calories.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup corn kernels (frozen, canned or roasted)
1/2 cup half and half (or more, as needed*)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large stockpot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add bacon and cook until brown and crispy, about 6-8 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate; set aside and drain excess fat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large stockpot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add bacon and cook until brown and crispy, about 6-8 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate; set aside and drain excess fat.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in the stockpot or Dutch oven. Add garlic, mushrooms and onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 3-4 minutes. Stir in thyme and dill until fragrant, about 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt butter in the stockpot or Dutch oven. Add garlic, mushrooms and onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 3-4 minutes. Stir in thyme and dill until fragrant, about 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk in flour until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Whisk in vegetable broth and bay leaf, and cook, whisking constantly, until slightly thickened, about 4-5 minutes. Stir in potatoes.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk in flour until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Whisk in vegetable broth and bay leaf, and cook, whisking constantly, until slightly thickened, about 4-5 minutes. Stir in potatoes.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 12-15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 12-15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in spinach and corn until the spinach begins to wilt, about 1-2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in spinach and corn until the spinach begins to wilt, about 1-2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in half and half until heated through, about 1-2 minutes; season with salt and pepper, to taste. If the soup is too thick, add more half and half as needed until desired consistency is reached.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, garnished with bacon and parsley, if desired.

review.reviewBody: I hate being one of those people that changes a recipe then reviews it, but my changes are for dietary intolerances and I want to let people know that it can be made dairy and gluten free. I followed exactly except for the following changes. I made a double batch and instead of the half and half, I used a can of full fat coconut milk. I did not use any thickener, instead I scooped about 4 cups with lots of the veggies and bacon, then I blended until smooth and added back to the soup and it thickened the whole soup perfectly. I did also use a whole pound of bacon because that was a personal choice.  Overall the flavours should be very close to the original recipe. I don’t find that the coconut milk makes it taste like coconut.

I have made, saved and remade 5 of your soup recipes over the years. Zucchini Corn Chowder, and Creamy Mushroom Chicken Soup have both been on my monthly rotation for at least 3 years. 

This particular recipe is basically the love child of those two and it’s glorious. Thank you!

This is so delicious and much yummier than I expected. I didn't have thyme by itself so, I ended up  using the Italian seasoning instead. This will forever go down as one of my favorite recipes of all time. Great job.
